image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from California; born in Glendale, Los Angeles County, Calif., October 30, 1950; graduated from Cupertino High School, Cupertino, Calif., 1968; B.A., University of California, Santa Cruz, Calif., 1972; J.D., University of the Pacific, McGeorge School of Law, Stockton, Calif., 1978; lawyer, private practice; member of the California state senate, 1981-1990; chair, California senate Republican caucus, 1987-1990; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Second and to the eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1991-January 3, 2009); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008.

researchRecord.name: 1988, 10 commercials on 3 videocassettes.
researchRecord.description: The commercials used during John Doolittle's campaign for the 1988 state senatorial election in District 1 of California, Republican Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication

researchRecord.name: 1983-1988, 8.5 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Bill files of California state senator John Doolittle from 1983-1984 and 1985-1986. The files also contain correspondence from 1985.

researchRecord.name: 1983-1988, 4 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Newspaper articles, speech drafts and votes on AIDS of John Doolittle from his tenure in the California state senate.

researchRecord.name: 1984-1987, 6 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Press files consisting of news clippings and news summaries for California state senator John Doolittle.

researchRecord.name: 1985-1990, 13 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Office files of John Doolittle from his tenure in the California state senate.

researchRecord.name: 1986-1988, 6 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Legislative correspondence, correspondence not responded to, district office correspondence, constituent letters, opinion cards, and anti-pornography petitions of California state senator John Doolittle.

researchRecord.name: 1987-1989, 1 cubic foot.
researchRecord.description: Sacramento office files of John Doolittle from his tenure in the California state senate.

researchRecord.name: 1988-1990, 3 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Legislative files of John Doolittle from his tenure in the California state senate.

researchRecord.name: 1989, 4.5 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Legislative correspondence files received by California state senator John Doolittle on other author's legislation
